Question:You are the President of the Student’s Union at your school. You are preparing a speech to welcome new students on the first day of school. In order to help new students achieve success and have an enjoyable school life, you want to talk about the following in your speech:
—importance of following school rules
—importance of interpersonal relationships

Good morning Principal, teacher abd fellow students,

On behalf of the Student’s Union, i’d like to welcome all of you to our school. I’m sure we all want to achieve success and have an enjoyable school life, so this morning I’d like to give you some advice.

To become a successful people, following school rules is essential. School creates school rules for protecting us. For example, we’re not allowed running on the floor anytime and the reason for the regulation is that reducing the chance of facing danger with us. Apart from that the consideration of protection, school rules can be used to constrain our temptation. School is a miniature of society. We need to have discipline in our society and school is no exception. Complying the laws is similar to conforming the school rules. All successful people in our society obey the law. Thus, this is fundamental to us.

Besides, the interpersonal relationship is also important for us. You can meet friends easily if you have better interpersonal relationship. It can expand your social circle and let you meet more friends who have similar habits to you. On top of this, when you had more friends who came from different background, it is helpful for you to tackle the problems you faced. Everyone has his special ability. In the whole secondary school life, we can’t deny that we’ll get into some troubles. You can solve it easily if you had many friends. It’s quiet important for the secondary school life.

All in all, i hope my sharing can inspire you to do some meaningful things in your following six years in our school. When you joined and clubs, don’t forget to be hard-working in academy as this is the responsibility of student. Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish! Enjoy your secondary school life! Thank you!

第二篇

Question: Many HK graduates complain about the lack of employment opportunities in the city. It has been suggested that graduates who fail to find a job in Hk could look for opportunities in other cities in Asia. Do u support this suggestion?
Write an article for your school magazine expressing your views. Give three reasons to support your views. Provide an appropriate title for your magazine.

Working overseas:
To be or Not to be?
Recently, there has been a heated controversy about whether the graduates who fail to find a job in Hong Kong to look for opportunities in other countries in Asia. I think that the suggestion is unrealistic. In this article, i will delve into the suggestion in the following.

First of all, working overseas exists the problem of recognition. As we all know,many graduates studied some special subjects, such as engineering, nursing, surveying etc. The graduates got the occupational license for their future carrer. Yet, their recognition may not be suitable in other districts. If they want to work in other area in Asia, they may have to use several years for the preparation of the examination due to the difference of the test between Hong Kong and other cities. It is a serious drawback of the suggestion and let me disagree the suggestion.

Apart from that, low salary is another problem. Hong Kong is a metropolis. We can get higher salary when we worked in here. Yet, when we work in other cities, like Taiwan or Korea, we only can get lower salary. Although it does not affect the daily life too much, the problem of lower salary will reflect on the the moment you have to buy some goods which came from other places instead of local stores. For instance, you have to pay a half of your monthly salary to buy a newest model IPhone if you worked in Hong Kong. In the contrast, you have to use a whole monthly salary to buy an IPhone if you worked in Taiwan. Not to mention when you need to give some money to family for the normal usages of home.

出唔晒



Last but not least, the graduates are hard to be comfortable in other countries due to the cultural difference. As we are Chinese people, we are keen to eat spicy hot pot or stinky tofu instead of sushi or kimchi. The graduates could not eat Hong Kong’s style food frequently when they worked in other cities. It will let them feel homesick. On top of the culinary difference, the more serious problem of working overseas is the discrimination. Raical discrimination in other districts is not unusual, especially in Japan and Korea. According to the survey of SCMP, Japanese and Korean hate the colleagues who came from different countries very much. Also, other racial people who worked in Japanese company are difficult to become an important position because of the racial discrimination. The graduates will be stress when they worked in this suffocating atmosphere. Thus, the suggestion is inappropriate.

In conclusion, based on three aforementioned problems which concluded the problem of recognition, the low salary and cultural difference, I strongly oppose the suggestion. You have to think twice if you want to work overseas in the future.

Good morning Principal, teacher abd fellow students,

On behalf of the Student’s Union, i’d like to welcome all of you to our school. I’m sure you all want to have an enjoyable and successful school life, so this morning I’d like to give you some advice.

To become successful, following school rules is essential because it protects all of us. For example, running around is against the school rule because it will cause accident. School is a miniature of society. Conforming the school rules is like complying the laws. Most successful people in our society obey the law. Thus, school rules are fundamental to you.

Interpersonal skill is also important to you. You can make friends easily if you have an good interpersonal skill. It helps you to expand your social circle and meet friends of different backgrounds. Friends play a very important role during your secondary school life because they help you to solve problems when you are in trouble.

I hope my sharing can inspire you and I hope you will find your six-years secondary school life meaningful. Don’t forget to be work hard and play hard. Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish! Enjoy your secondary school life! Thank you!

第二篇

Question: Many HK graduates complain about the lack of employment opportunities in the city. It has been suggested that graduates who fail to find a job in Hk could look for opportunities in other cities in Asia. Do u support this suggestion?
Write an article for your school magazine expressing your views. Give three reasons to support your views. Provide an appropriate title for your magazine.

Working overseas:
To be or Not to be?
Recently, there has been a heated controversy about whether the graduates who fail to find a job in Hong Kong to look for opportunities in other countries in Asia. I think that the suggestion is unrealistic. In this article, i will delve into the suggestion in the following.

First of all, working overseas exists the problem of recognition. As we all know,many graduates studied some special subjects, such as engineering, nursing, surveying etc. The graduates got the occupational license for their future carrer. Yet, their recognition may not be suitable in other districts. If they want to work in other area in Asia, they may have to use several years for the preparation of the examination due to the difference of the test between Hong Kong and other cities. It is a serious drawback of the suggestion and let me disagree the suggestion.

Apart from that, low salary is another problem. Hong Kong is a metropolis. We can get higher salary when we worked in here. Yet, when we work in other cities, like Taiwan or Korea, we only can get lower salary. Although it does not affect the daily life too much, the problem of lower salary will reflect on the the moment you have to buy some goods which came from other places instead of local stores. For instance, you have to pay a half of your monthly salary to buy a newest model IPhone if you worked in Hong Kong. In the contrast, you have to use a whole monthly salary to buy an IPhone if you worked in Taiwan. Not to mention when you need to give some money to family for the normal usages of home.

replies.msg:
都係幫你整順返d句子, 要執vocab可以用字典

另外應盡量避免用用 "I", 可以用passive voice去代替first person.

Recently, there is a heated controversy about whether the Hong Kong graduates who fail to find in a job in Hong Kong should look for opportunities in other Asian cities. I do not support the suggestion of finding a job overseas due to the following reasons.

First of all, finding a job overseas is unrealistic due to the fact that not all Hong Kong graduates are recognied by other countries, e.g., graduates of engineering, nursing, surveying, etc. If they want to work in another Asian country, they may have to spend several years to study again in order to get a license in that particular country. It is one of the reasons that Hong Kong graduates should not find a job overseas.

Apart from that. the difference in salary compared to other Asian cities is another reason that Hong Kong grudates should not find a job overseas. Hong Kong is a metropolis and the average salary in Hong Kong is higher than other Asians cities, e.g.,Taiwan and Korea. For instance, you can purchase the newest IPhone model with half of your salary in Hong Kong. In contrast, you may have to use your whole amount of salary to buy an IPhone in inTaiwan, which leaves you no money for family and daily living.

Question:You are the President of the Student’s Union at your school. You are preparing a speech to welcome new students on the first day of school. In order to help new students achieve success and have an enjoyable school life, you want to talk about the following in your speech:
—importance of following school rules
—importance of interpersonal relationships

Good morning Principal, teacher abd fellow students,

On behalf of the Student’s Union, i’d like to welcome all of you to our school. I’m sure we all want to achieve success and have an enjoyable school life, so this morning I’d like to give you some advice.

To become a successful people, following school rules is essential. School creates school rules for protecting us. For example, we’re not allowed running on the floor anytime and the reason for the regulation is that reducing the chance of facing danger with us. Apart from that the consideration of protection, school rules can be used to constrain our temptation. School is a miniature of society. We need to have discipline in our society and school is no exception. Complying the laws is similar to conforming the school rules. All successful people in our society obey the law. Thus, this is fundamental to us.

Besides, the interpersonal relationship is also important for us. You can meet friends easily if you have better interpersonal relationship. It can expand your social circle and let you meet more friends who have similar habits to you. On top of this, when you had more friends who came from different background, it is helpful for you to tackle the problems you faced. Everyone has his special ability. In the whole secondary school life, we can’t deny that we’ll get into some troubles. You can solve it easily if you had many friends. It’s quiet important for the secondary school life.

All in all, i hope my sharing can inspire you to do some meaningful things in your following six years in our school. When you joined and clubs, don’t forget to be hard-working in academy as this is the responsibility of student. Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish! Enjoy your secondary school life! Thank you!

Question:You are the President of the Student’s Union at your school. You are preparing a speech to welcome new students on the first day of school. In order to help new students achieve success and have an enjoyable school life, you want to talk about the following in your speech:
—importance of following school rules
—importance of interpersonal relationships

Good morning Principal, teacher abd fellow students,

On behalf of the Student’s Union, i’d like to welcome all of you to our school. I’m sure we all want to achieve success and have an enjoyable school life, so this morning I’d like to give you some advice.

To become a successful people, following school rules is essential. School creates school rules for protecting us. For example, we’re not allowed running on the floor anytime and the reason for the regulation is that reducing the chance of facing danger with us. Apart from that the consideration of protection, school rules can be used to constrain our temptation. School is a miniature of society. We need to have discipline in our society and school is no exception. Complying the laws is similar to conforming the school rules. All successful people in our society obey the law. Thus, this is fundamental to us.

Besides, the interpersonal relationship is also important for us. You can meet friends easily if you have better interpersonal relationship. It can expand your social circle and let you meet more friends who have similar habits to you. On top of this, when you had more friends who came from different background, it is helpful for you to tackle the problems you faced. Everyone has his special ability. In the whole secondary school life, we can’t deny that we’ll get into some troubles. You can solve it easily if you had many friends. It’s quiet important for the secondary school life.

All in all, i hope my sharing can inspire you to do some meaningful things in your following six years in our school. When you joined and clubs, don’t forget to be hard-working in academy as this is the responsibility of student. Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish! Enjoy your secondary school life! Thank you!
